data.Sentence_cn: 无罪
data.Sentence: --- lesson 11  Not guilty

data.Sentence_cn: 现在的海关官员往往相当宽容。
data.Sentence: Customs Officers are quite tolerant these days,

data.Sentence_cn: 但是，当你通过绿色通道，没有任何东西需要申报时，他们仍可以拦住你。
data.Sentence: but they can still stop you when you are going through the Green Channel and have nothing to declare.

data.Sentence_cn: 甚至是最诚实的人也常弄得觉得有罪似的，
data.Sentence: Even really honest people are often made to feel guilty.

data.Sentence_cn: 而老练的职业走私犯却即使在手提箱里藏着500只金表，却也处之泰然。
data.Sentence: The hardened professional smuggler, on the other hand, is never troubled by such feelings, even if he has five hundred gold watches hidden in his suitcase.

data.Sentence_cn: 最近一次，我也出国归来，碰上一位特别好管闲事的年轻海关官员，他显然把我当成了走私犯。
data.Sentence: When I returned from abroad recently, a particularly officious young Customs Officer clearly regarded me as a smuggler.

data.Sentence_cn: “您有什么需要申报的吗?”他直盯着我的眼睛问。
data.Sentence: 'Have you anything to declare?' he asked, looking me in the eye.

data.Sentence_cn: “没有。”我自信地回答说。
data.Sentence: 'No,' I answered confidently.

data.Sentence_cn: “请打开这只手提箱好吗?”
data.Sentence: 'Would you mind unlocking this suitcase please?'

data.Sentence_cn: “好的。”我回答说。
data.Sentence: 'Not at all,' I answered.

data.Sentence_cn: 那位官员十分仔细地把箱子检查了一遍。
data.Sentence: The Officer went through the case with great care.

data.Sentence_cn: 所有细心包装好的东西一会儿工夫就乱成一团。
data.Sentence: All the things I had packed so carefully were soon in a dreadful mess.

data.Sentence_cn: 我相信那箱子再也关不上了。
data.Sentence: I felt sure I would never be able to close the case again.

data.Sentence_cn: 突然，我看到官员脸上露出了得意的神色。
data.Sentence: Suddenly, I saw the Officer's face light up.

data.Sentence_cn: 他在我的箱底发现了一只小瓶，高兴地一把抓了起来。
data.Sentence: He had spotted a tiny bottle at the bottom of my case and he pounced on it with delight.

data.Sentence_cn: “香水，嗯?”他讥讽地说道，
data.Sentence: 'Perfume, eh?' he asked sarcastically.

data.Sentence_cn: “你刚才应该申报，香水要上进口税的。”
data.Sentence: 'You should have declared that. Perfume is not exempt from import duty.'

data.Sentence_cn: “不，这不是香水，”我说，
data.Sentence: 'But it isn't perfume,' I said.

data.Sentence_cn: “是发胶。”接着我脸带微笑补充说：
data.Sentence: 'It's hair gel.' Then I added with a smile,

data.Sentence_cn: “这是一种我自己配制的奇特的混合物。”
data.Sentence: 'It's a strange mixture I make myself.'

data.Sentence_cn: 果不出所料，他并不相信我。
data.Sentence: As I expected, he did not believe me.

data.Sentence_cn: “你就闻一闻吧！”我催促说。
data.Sentence: 'Try it!' I said encouragingly.

data.Sentence_cn: 海关官员拧开瓶盖，把瓶子放到鼻子底下。
data.Sentence: The officer unscrewed the cap and put the bottle to his nostrils.

data.Sentence_cn: 一股怪味袭来，使他相信了我说的真话。
data.Sentence: He was greeted by an unpleasant smell which convinced him that I was telling the truth.

data.Sentence_cn: 几分钟后，我终于被放行，手提划着宝贵的粉笔记号的行李，匆匆离去。
data.Sentence: A few minutes later, I was able to hurry away with precious chalk marks on my baggage.
